00001 <?php
00002       /*
00003       This is an upload script for SWFUpload that attempts to properly handle uploaded files
00004       in a secure way.
00005 
00006       Notes:
00007             
00008             SWFUpload doesn't send a MIME-TYPE. In my opinion this is ok since MIME-TYPE is no better than
00009              file extension and is probably worse because it can vary from OS to OS and browser to browser (for the same file).
00010              The best thing to do is content sniff the file but this can be resource intensive, is difficult, and can still be fooled or inaccurate.
00011              Accepting uploads can never be 100% secure.
00012              
00013             You can't guarantee that SWFUpload is really the source of the upload.  A malicious user
00014              will probably be uploading from a tool that sends invalid or false metadata about the file.
00015              The script should properly handle this.
00016              
00017             The script should not over-write existing files.
00018             
00019             The script should strip away invalid characters from the file name or reject the file.
00020             
00021             The script should not allow files to be saved that could then be executed on the webserver (such as .php files).
00022              To keep things simple we will use an extension whitelist for allowed file extensions.  Which files should be allowed
00023              depends on your server configuration. The extension white-list is _not_ tied your SWFUpload file_types setting
00024             
00025             For better security uploaded files should be stored outside the webserver's document root.  Downloaded files
00026              should be accessed via a download script that proxies from the file system to the webserver.  This prevents
00027              users from executing malicious uploaded files.  It also gives the developer control over the outgoing mime-type,
00028              access restrictions, etc.  This, however, is outside the scope of this script.
00029             
00030             SWFUpload sends each file as a separate POST rather than several files in a single post. This is a better
00031              method in my opinions since it better handles file size limits, e.g., if post_max_size is 100 MB and I post two 60 MB files then
00032              the post would fail (2x60MB = 120MB). In SWFupload each 60 MB is posted as separate post and we stay within the limits. This
00033              also simplifies the upload script since we only have to handle a single file.
00034             
00035             The script should properly handle situations where the post was too large or the posted file is larger than
00036              our defined max.  These values are not tied to your SWFUpload file_size_limit setting.
00037       */
00038       
00039       # added
00040       # no direct call
00041       if( defined( 'NO_DIRECT_CALL' ) === false )
00042       {
00043             exit( 0 );
00044       }
00045       # ~added
00046       
00047       // Code for Session Cookie workaround
00048       if (isset($_POST["PHPSESSID"])) {
00049             session_id($_POST["PHPSESSID"]);
00050       } else if (isset($_GET["PHPSESSID"])) {
00051             session_id($_GET["PHPSESSID"]);
00052       }
00053       
00054       @session_start();
00055       
00056       // Check post_max_size (http://us3.php.net/manual/en/features.file-upload.php#73762)
00057       $POST_MAX_SIZE = ini_get('post_max_size');
00058       $unit = strtoupper(substr($POST_MAX_SIZE, -1));
00059       $multiplier = ($unit == 'M' ? 1048576 : ($unit == 'K' ? 1024 : ($unit == 'G' ? 1073741824 : 1)));
00060 
00061       if ((int)@$_SERVER['CONTENT_LENGTH'] > $multiplier*(int)$POST_MAX_SIZE && $POST_MAX_SIZE) {
00062             header("HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error"); // This will trigger an uploadError event in SWFUpload
00063             echo "POST exceeded maximum allowed size.";
00064             exit(0);
00065       }
00066       
00067       // Settings
00068       // added $save_path = getcwd() . "/data/";                        // The path were we will save the file (getcwd() may not be reliable and should be tested in your environment)
00069       global      $save_path;
00070       $upload_name = "Filedata";
00071       $max_file_size_in_bytes = 2147483647;                       // 2GB in bytes
00072       # added $extension_whitelist = array("jpg", "gif", "png");  // Allowed file extensions
00073       global      $extension_whitelist;
00074       # ~added
00075       $valid_chars_regex = '.A-Z0-9_ !@#$%^&()+={}\[\]\',~`-';                      // Characters allowed in the file name (in a Regular Expression format)
00076       
00077       // Other variables      
00078       $MAX_FILENAME_LENGTH = 260;
00079       global      $file_name;
00080       $file_name = "";
00081       $file_extension = "";
00082       $uploadErrors = array(
00083         0=>"There is no error, the file uploaded with success",
00084         1=>"The uploaded file exceeds the upload_max_filesize directive in php.ini",
00085         2=>"The uploaded file exceeds the MAX_FILE_SIZE directive that was specified in the HTML form",
00086         3=>"The uploaded file was only partially uploaded",
00087         4=>"No file was uploaded",
00088         6=>"Missing a temporary folder"
00089       );
00090 
00091       // Validate the upload
00092       if (!isset($_FILES[$upload_name])) {
00093             HandleError("No upload found in \$_FILES for " . $upload_name);
00094             exit(0);
00095       } else if (isset($_FILES[$upload_name]["error"]) && $_FILES[$upload_name]["error"] != 0) {
00096             HandleError($uploadErrors[$_FILES[$upload_name]["error"]]);
00097             exit(0);
00098       } else if (!isset($_FILES[$upload_name]["tmp_name"]) || !@is_uploaded_file($_FILES[$upload_name]["tmp_name"])) {
00099             HandleError("Upload failed is_uploaded_file test.");
00100             exit(0);
00101       } else if (!isset($_FILES[$upload_name]['name'])) {
00102             HandleError("File has no name.");
00103             exit(0);
00104       }
00105       
00106       // Validate the file size (Warning: the largest files supported by this code is 2GB)
00107       $file_size = @filesize($_FILES[$upload_name]["tmp_name"]);
00108       if (!$file_size || $file_size > $max_file_size_in_bytes) {
00109             HandleError("File exceeds the maximum allowed size");
00110             exit(0);
00111       }
00112       
00113       if ($file_size <= 0) {
00114             HandleError("File size outside allowed lower bound");
00115             exit(0);
00116       }
00117       
00118       // Validate file name (for our purposes we'll just remove invalid characters)
00119       # added
00120       #$file_name = preg_replace('/[^'.$valid_chars_regex.']|\.+$/i', "", basename($_FILES[$upload_name]['name']));
00121       $file_name = basename($_FILES[$upload_name]['name']);
00122       # ~added
00123       
00124       # added
00125       global      $original_file_name;
00126       $original_file_name = $file_name;
00127       $file_name = md5( $file_name.microtime( true ) );
00128       # ~added
00129 
00130       if (strlen($file_name) == 0 || strlen($file_name) > $MAX_FILENAME_LENGTH) {
00131             HandleError("Invalid file name");
00132             exit(0);
00133       }
00134 
00135 
00136       // Validate that we won't over-write an existing file
00137       # added
00138       #if (file_exists($save_path . $file_name)) {
00139       #     HandleError("File with this name already exists");
00140       #     exit(0);
00141       #}
00142       # ~added
00143       
00144       // Validate file extension
00145       $path_info = pathinfo($_FILES[$upload_name]['name']);
00146       $file_extension = $path_info["extension"];
00147       $is_valid_extension = false;
00148       foreach ($extension_whitelist as $extension) {
00149             # added
00150             if( $extension == '*' ){
00151                   $is_valid_extension = true;
00152                   break;
00153             }
00154             # ~added
00155             if (strcasecmp($file_extension, $extension) == 0) {
00156                   $is_valid_extension = true;
00157                   break;
00158             }
00159       }
00160       if (!$is_valid_extension) {
00161             HandleError("Invalid file extension");
00162             exit(0);
00163       }
00164 
00165       // Validate file contents (extension and mime-type can't be trusted)
00166       /*
00167             Validating the file contents is OS and web server configuration dependant.  Also, it may not be reliable.
00168             See the comments on this page: http://us2.php.net/fileinfo
00169             
00170             Also see http://72.14.253.104/search?q=cache:3YGZfcnKDrYJ:www.scanit.be/uploads/php-file-upload.pdf+php+file+command&hl=en&ct=clnk&cd=8&gl=us&client=firefox-a
00171              which describes how a PHP script can be embedded within a GIF image file.
00172             
00173             Therefore, no sample code will be provided here.  Research the issue, decide how much security is
00174              needed, and implement a solution that meets the needs.
00175       */
00176 
00177 
00178       // Process the file
00179       /*
00180             At this point we are ready to process the valid file. This sample code shows how to save the file. Other tasks
00181              could be done such as creating an entry in a database or generating a thumbnail.
00182              
00183             Depending on your server OS and needs you may need to set the Security Permissions on the file after it has
00184             been saved.
00185       */
00186       if (!@move_uploaded_file($_FILES[$upload_name]["tmp_name"], $save_path.$file_name)) {
00187             HandleError("File could not be saved.");
00188             exit(0);
00189       }
00190 
00191       /* Handles the error output. This error message will be sent to the uploadSuccess event handler.  The event handler
00192       will have to check for any error messages and react as needed. */
00193       function HandleError($message) {
00194             echo $message;
00195       }
00196 ?>
